A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This movie was more like a Star Wars parody than an actual Star Wars movie\, starting with Poe Dameron's trolling of General Hux. That was a scene I would expect to see in an episode of Robot Chicken. The entire Canto Bight scene was a waste of time. It made no sense and didn't add anything to the story. Major plot-points went unresolved or were resolved in completely unsatisfactory ways such as Snokes origins and Reys parents. Luke Skywalker in this movie didn't behave the way we would expect from a character we know so well and just struck a wrong note in every scene we saw him in up until the grand finale. His death made no sense either. I could go on and on about why I disliked this movie so much. I love Star Wars which is why I am so disappointed in The Last Jedi and will probably not go see Solo in the cinemas. My small way of sending Disney a message that they need course correction here.
